newsitem.title: USA: Vermont legislature passes landmark tax reform bill.
newsitem.headline: Vermont legislature passes landmark tax reform bill.

text.p: The Vermont House and Senate Thursday gave final approval to a tax plan which includes the state's first-ever property tax and radically changes the way the state will fund education in the future.
The property tax revenue will be sent to the capital and returned to towns in block grants of about $5,000 per pupil.
Towns can then raise more money through a local property tax if they so choose.
The new bill will raise the state's share of education funding from the current 30 percent to nearly 80 percent.
The bill resulted from a state Supreme Court decision in February that declared the state's method of funding education unconstitutional because of property tax inequities from town to town.
Gov. Howard Dean has said he will sign the bill into law, probably early next week.
